title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 4.2 - Adjoining or adjacent facilities
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 4.2 - Adjoining or adjacent facilities

State Regulations

The establishment of the following does not require
authorization by the superintendent: (a) Any facility which adjoins the wall of an
existing office of an institution. (b) Any facility which is within 150 feet of
the nearest wall of an institution's principal office or branch provided that
such facility is located on the same property or property contiguous with the
principal office or branch and there is no intervening space occupied or which
may be occupied by anyone else (except for purposes of parking by bank
customers and employees), and no public street or thoroughfare, between the
facility and the institution's principal office or branch. However, the
superintendent must be notified of an institution's intention to open such
facility at least 30 days in advance of such opening and such institution must
provide proof satisfactory to the superintendent that the facility meets the
above criteria. Notes

4.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
